reviewText: lol
One of my favorite Korean actresses, lived her in "innocent steps" and "my little bride" this genre is in the melodrama which I'm not a big fan of but still the movie was enjoyable l.
I'm just getting into Asian films! I'm pretty tired of the crap Hollywood has been throwing out there! This is a beautifully acted movie and a great story!
What an amazing movie... the actors were amazing and it's a nice love story... I didn't get the ending but I genuinely enjoyed it.
what can be said. It was a corny movie that was surprisingly good.  Good storyline, start to finish.
A melodrama in the vein of so many K-dramas, so be forewarned.  Moon Geun-young is a beautiful actress who brings a serene quality to so many of her roles.  Loved her in Innocent Steps.

The movie is great.  It's a beautiful dark love story without too much sap.  The DVD, however, is not great.  I did not realize until it arrived that it only plays on Korean DVD players.  So, that's no good for me or anyone else in the rest of the world.

Once I became a fan of Moon Geun-Young, I just had to see everything she was in. This is a story that could be real life and was excellently told. A wonder story that showed that lengths that people will go for money! Enjoy! Its worth it!
Intense!
Great

I like the series version (The Winter The Wind Blows) better.
I think the movie was too condensed that which prevented a fully developed storyline.  Good actors and the ending was interesting.
I'm glad that made this into a drama.  That Winter, The Wind Blows.
GREAT

Nice ending.  Love it.
The lead actress did a great job of portraying a blind woman. Her beauty and soft spoken elegance is very enchanting and clearly makes the movie enjoyable.

Really enjoyed this movie. Not a typical plot. Pay attention to details so you can really enjoy story and meaning. Must watch for a movie night.

This was a good story but sad.

The ending absolutely kills it; seriously, makes it not worth watching. From reading the other reviews, I see this is based on a Japanese television show from 2002 (Ai Nante Irane Yo, Natsu); might should check that out, instead. This movie is very typical Korean fare with decent actors and "bad guy turns good" storyline, but there are better offerings very similar to this specific movie's story- "Man in Love" comes to mind. Just skip this, unless you like endings where you say "is this guy stupid, or what?" followed by "So, wait, what happened now?"
Ok entertainment
I think I prefer the other movie version: "The Winter Wind that Blows" and for this version I would give 6 stars.
This is a good story with a twist at the end
